title.narrative: Prevention and Mitigation of public health risks of drought in Somaliland, Galmudug, Hirshabelle, Jubaland and Puntland

description.narrative: WHO aims to reach an estimated 158,009 vulnerable Somalis with health interventions and measures to strengthen readiness for disease outbreak detection and response ahead of malaria, measles, and cholera outbreaks. This includes comprehensive training (11 RRTs; 840 community health workers on skills like management of epidemic-prone diseases, surveillance, infection control and prevention, and risk communication; 100 professional health workers on SAM management, 50 district health teams on water quality surveillance; and 120 health workers on sample collection, packaging and shipment). In addition, WHO is procuring 25 medical kit packages in health facilities containing cholera kits, SAM kits and sample collection kits.
